multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have loose and sagging skin on my cheeks, neck, axilla, and thighs.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've had loose skin since birth, and it has progressively worsened over time.
Do you have any joint issues or hyperflexibility?
No, I don't have any joint issues or hyperflexibility.
Do you have any family members with similar skin issues or any diagnosed genetic disorders?
Yes, my mother mentioned that other family members may have similar skin issues.
Have you or any family members experienced spontaneous bruising or delayed wound healing?
No, I have not experienced spontaneous bruising or delayed wound healing, and there's no mention of family members having these issues.
Final Diagnosis: Cutis Laxa
